Pre-Game Insights: England won their opening two UEFA Nations League B2 games under new interim manager Lee Carsley, convincingly defeating Ireland and Finland. The Three Lions won both games 2-0 with Declan Rice and Jack Grealish both scoring against the Republic, while Harry Kane scored both goals against Finland on the night he won his 100th cap.

Greece also started a new managerial era with the appointment of Ivan Jovanovic. They took six points from Finland and Ireland in the first round of games, beating them 3-0 and 2-0 respectively. Under previous manager they played two international friendlies in June, as they didn't take part in the European Championship.
England have never lost to their opponents in nine previous meetings, seven of which they won. Anyway, this will be the first match between the two countries in 18 years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be played at Wembley Stadium in London, England.
England are huge favourites to take maximum points, as they are priced at around 3/10 (1.30). The draw is 9/2 (5.50) while a shocking victory for the visitors can be backed at 12/1 (13.00).
England to win to NIL: BEST ODDS 1.29
Anytime Goalscorer: Cole Palmer to score anytime: BEST ODDS 3.80
Greece to get the most cards: BEST ODDS 2.25
